newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian market plans to trade second-tier stocks.
newsitem.headline: Russian market plans to trade second-tier stocks.

text.p: The Russian Trading System (RTS) will open a new segment for second-tier stocks by the end of this year, the head of the national brokers' association NAUFOR, which operates the RTS, said on Tuesday.

Listing requirements for the second tier of the RTS, which is similar to the U.S. NASDAQ system, will be substantially easier than for the first tier, NAUFOR president Dmitry Ponomarev told a securities market conference.
On the first tier 85 shares are listed.
Companies will be eligible for a listing in the second tier if their capital exceeds five billion roubles and they provide accounts for the previous year.
